testcase.name: GET /users returns list of users
testcase.system-out: Given the API is available When I send a GET request to /users Then the response status should be 200 And the response should contain a list of users

testcase.name: POST /users creates a new user
testcase.system-out: Given the API is available When I send a POST request to /users with valid data Then the response status should be 201 And the user should be created

testcase.name: GET /users/{id} returns user details
testcase.system-out: Given a user exists with id 123 When I send a GET request to /users/123 Then the response status should be 200 And the response should contain user details

testcase.name: PUT /users/{id} updates user
testcase.system-out: Given a user exists with id 123 When I send a PUT request to /users/123 with updated data Then the response status should be 200 And the user should be updated

testcase.name: DELETE /users/{id} removes user
testcase.system-out: Given a user exists with id 123 When I send a DELETE request to /users/123 Then the response status should be 204

testcase.name: GET /users with invalid token returns 401
testcase.system-out: Given the API requires authentication When I send a GET request without a valid token Then the response status should be 401

testcase.name: POST /users with invalid data returns 400
testcase.system-out: Given the API is available When I send a POST request with invalid data Then the response status should be 400 And the response should contain validation errors
